name: auth0
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing auth0 cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`auth0` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/auth0/terraform-provider-auth0).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing auth0 cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/auth0/terraform-provider-auth0)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-auth0` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-auth0/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`auth0/terraform-provider-auth0` repo](https://github.com/auth0/terraform-provider-auth0/issues).

adminNotificationFrequencies.description: When "admin_notification" is enabled, determines how often email notifications are sent. Possible values: `immediately`, `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`.

enabled.description: Whether or not breached password detection is active.

method.description: The subscription level for breached password detection methods. Use "enhanced" to enable Credential Guard. Possible values: `standard`, `enhanced`.

shields.description: Action to take when a breached password is detected. Possible values: `block`, `user_notification`, `admin_notification`.

allowlists.description: List of trusted IP addresses that will not have attack protection enforced against them.

enabled.description: Whether or not breached password detection is active.

maxAttempts.description: Maximum number of unsuccessful attempts. Only available on public tenants.

mode.description: Determines whether or not IP address is used when counting failed attempts. Possible values: `count_per_identifier_and_ip` or `count_per_identifier`.

shields.description: Action to take when a breached password is detected. Possible values: `block`, `user_notification`, `admin_notification`.

allowlists.description: List of trusted IP addresses that will not have attack protection enforced against them.

enabled.description: Whether or not breached password detection is active.

preLogin.description: Configuration options that apply before every login attempt. Only available on public tenants.

preUserRegistration.description: Configuration options that apply before every user registration attempt. Only available on public tenants.

shields.description: Action to take when a breached password is detected. Possible values: `block`, `user_notification`, `admin_notification`.

maxAttempts.description: Maximum number of unsuccessful attempts. Only available on public tenants.
Maximum number of unsuccessful attempts. Only available on public tenants.

pageBackground.description: String, Hexadecimal. Background color of login pages.

primary.description: String, Hexadecimal. Primary button background color.

url.description: String. URL for the custom font.

samlp.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for a SAML add-on. For details, see SAML.

audience.description: String. Audience of the SAML Assertion. Default will be the Issuer on SAMLRequest.

authnContextClassRef.description: String. Class reference of the authentication context.

binding.description: String. Protocol binding used for SAML logout responses.

createUpnClaim.description: Boolean, (Default=true) Indicates whether or not a UPN claim should be created.

destination.description: String. Destination of the SAML Response. If not specified, it will be AssertionConsumerUrlof SAMLRequest or Callback URL if there was no SAMLRequest.

digestAlgorithm.description: String, (Default=`sha1`). Algorithm used to calculate the digest of the SAML Assertion or response. Options include `defaultsha1` and `sha256`.

includeAttributeNameFormat.description: Boolean,(Default=true). Indicates whether or not we should infer the NameFormat based on the attribute name. If set to false, the attribute NameFormat is not set in the assertion.

lifetimeInSeconds.description: Integer, (Default=3600). Number of seconds during which the token is valid.

logout.description: Map(Resource). Configuration settings for logout. For details, see Logout.

mapIdentities.description: Boolean, (Default=true). Indicates whether or not to add additional identity information in the token, such as the provider used and the access_token, if available.

mapUnknownClaimsAsIs.description: Boolean, (Default=false). Indicates whether or not to add a prefix of `http://schema.auth0.com` to any claims that are not mapped to the common profile when passed through in the output assertion.

mappings.description: Map(String). Mappings between the Auth0 user profile property name (`name`) and the output attributes on the SAML attribute in the assertion (`value`).

nameIdentifierFormat.description: String, (Default=`urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:unspecified`). Format of the name identifier.

nameIdentifierProbes.description: List(String). Attributes that can be used for Subject/NameID. Auth0 will try each of the attributes of this array in order and use the first value it finds.

passthroughClaimsWithNoMapping.description: Boolean, (Default=true). Indicates whether or not to passthrough claims that are not mapped to the common profile in the output assertion.

recipient.description: String. Recipient of the SAML Assertion (SubjectConfirmationData). Default is AssertionConsumerUrl on SAMLRequest or Callback URL if no SAMLRequest was sent.

signResponse.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not the SAML Response should be signed instead of the SAML Assertion.

signatureAlgorithm.description: String, (Default=`rsa-sha1`). Algorithm used to sign the SAML Assertion or response. Options include `rsa-sha1` and `rsa-sha256`.

signingCert.description:
String. Optionally indicates the public key certificate used to validate SAML requests. If set, SAML requests will be required to be signed. A sample value would be `-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----
MIGf...bpP/t3
+JGNGIRMj1hF1rnb6QIDAQAB
-----END PUBLIC KEY-----
`.

typedAttributes.description: Boolean, (Default=true). Indicates whether or not we should infer the `xs:type` of the element. Types include `xs:string`, `xs:boolean`, `xs:double`, and `xs:anyType`. When set to false, all `xs:type` are `xs:anyType`.

alg.description: String. Algorithm used to sign JWTs.

lifetimeInSeconds.description: Integer. Number of seconds during which the JWT will be valid.

secretEncoded.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not the client secret is base64 encoded.

android.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for Android native apps. For details, see Android.

ios.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for i0S native apps. For details, see iOS.

expirationType.description: String. Options include `expiring`, `non-expiring`. Whether a refresh token will expire based on an absolute lifetime, after which the token can no longer be used. If rotation is `rotating`, this must be set to `expiring`.

idleTokenLifetime.description: Integer. The time in seconds after which inactive refresh tokens will expire.

infiniteIdleTokenLifetime.description: Boolean, (Default=false) Whether or not inactive refresh tokens should be remain valid indefinitely.

infiniteTokenLifetime.description: Boolean, (Default=false) Whether or not refresh tokens should remain valid indefinitely. If false, `token_lifetime` should also be set

leeway.description: Integer. The amount of time in seconds in which a refresh token may be reused without trigging reuse detection.

rotationType.description: String. Options include `rotating`, `non-rotating`. When `rotating`, exchanging a refresh token will cause a new refresh token to be issued and the existing token will be invalidated. This allows for automatic detection of token reuse if the token is leaked.

tokenLifetime.description: Integer. The absolute lifetime of a refresh token in seconds.

bruteForceProtection.description: Indicates whether or not to enable brute force protection, which will limit the number of signups and failed logins from a suspicious IP address.

configuration.description: A case-sensitive map of key value pairs used as configuration variables for the `custom_script`.

customScripts.description: Custom database action scripts. For more information, read [Custom Database Action Script Templates](https://auth0.com/docs/connections/database/custom-db/templates).

debug.description: (Boolean) When enabled additional debugging information will be generated.

disableSignup.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not to allow user sign-ups to your application.

domainAliases.description: List of the domains that can be authenticated using the Identity Provider. Only needed for Identifier First authentication flows.

entityId.description: Custom Entity ID for the connection.

fieldsMap.description: SAML Attributes mapping. If you're configuring a SAML enterprise connection for a non-standard PingFederate Server, you must update the attribute mappings.

from.description: SMS number for the sender. Used when SMS Source is From.

idpInitiated.description: Configuration Options for IDP Initiated Authentication.  This is an object with the properties: `client_id`, `client_protocol`, and `client_authorize_query`

importMode.description: Indicates whether or not you have a legacy user store and want to gradually migrate those users to the Auth0 user store. [Learn more](https://auth0.com/docs/users/guides/configure-automatic-migration).

maxGroupsToRetrieve.description: Maximum number of groups to retrieve.

messagingServiceSid.description: SID for Copilot. Used when SMS Source is Copilot.

mfa.description: Configuration settings Options for multifactor authentication. For details, see MFA Options.

nonPersistentAttrs.description: If there are user fields that should not be stored in Auth0 databases due to privacy reasons, you can add them to the denylist. See [here](https://auth0.com/docs/security/denylist-user-attributes) for more info.

passwordComplexityOptions.description: Configuration settings for password complexity. For details, see Password Complexity Options.

passwordDictionary.description: Configuration settings for the password dictionary check, which does not allow passwords that are part of the password dictionary. For details, see Password Dictionary.

passwordHistories.description: Configuration settings for the password history that is maintained for each user to prevent the reuse of passwords. For details, see Password History.

passwordNoPersonalInfo.description: Configuration settings for the password personal info check, which does not allow passwords that contain any part of the user's personal data, including user's name, username, nickname, user_metadata.name, user_metadata.first, user_metadata.last, user's email, or first part of the user's email. For details, see Password No Personal Info.

passwordPolicy.description: Indicates level of password strength to enforce during authentication. A strong password policy will make it difficult, if not improbable, for someone to guess a password through either manual or automated means. Options include `none`, `low`, `fair`, `good`, `excellent`.

protocolBinding.description: The SAML Response Binding - how the SAML token is received by Auth0 from IdP. Two possible values are `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-Redirect` (default) and `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`

requestTemplate.description: Template that formats the SAML request

requiresUsername.description: Indicates whether or not the user is required to provide a username in addition to an email address.

scopes.description: Scopes required by the connection. The value must be a list, for example `["openid", "profile", "email"]`.

setUserRootAttributes.description: Determines whether the 'name', 'given_name', 'family_name', 'nickname', and 'picture' attributes can be independently updated when using the external IdP. Default is `on_each_login` and can be set to `on_first_login`.

shouldTrustEmailVerifiedConnection.description: Determines how Auth0 sets the email_verified field in the user profile. Can either be set to `never_set_emails_as_verified` or `always_set_emails_as_verified`.

signInEndpoint.description: SAML single login URL for the connection.

signOutEndpoint.description: SAML single logout URL for the connection.

signSamlRequest.description: (Boolean) When enabled, the SAML authentication request will be signed.

signingCert.description: The X.509 signing certificate (encoded in PEM or CER) you retrieved from the IdP, Base64-encoded

syntax.description: Syntax of the SMS. Options include `markdown` and `liquid`.

template.description: Template for the SMS. You can use `@@password@@` as a placeholder for the password value.

totp.description: Configuration options for one-time passwords. For details, see TOTP.

userIdAttribute.description: Attribute in the SAML token that will be mapped to the user_id property in Auth0.

validation.description: Validation of the minimum and maximum values allowed for a user to have as username. For details, see Validation.

waadCommonEndpoint.description: Indicates whether or not to use the common endpoint rather than the default endpoint. Typically enabled if you're using this for a multi-tenant application in Azure AD.

active.description: Indicates whether multifactor authentication is enabled for this connection.

returnEnrollSettings.description: Indicates whether multifactor authentication enrollment settings will be returned.

minLength.description: Minimum number of characters allowed in passwords.

dictionaries.description: Customized contents of the password dictionary. By default, the password dictionary contains a list of the [10,000 most common passwords](https://github.com/danielmiessler/SecLists/blob/master/Passwords/Common-Credentials/10k-most-common.txt); your customized content is used in addition to the default password dictionary. Matching is not case-sensitive.

enable.description: Indicates whether the password dictionary check is enabled for this connection.

Indicates whether password history is enabled for the connection. When enabled, any existing users in this connection will be unaffected; the system will maintain their password history going forward.

size.description: Indicates the number of passwords to keep in history with a maximum of 24.

enable.description: Indicates whether the password personal info check is enabled for this connection.

length.description: Integer. Length of the one-time password.

timeStep.description: Integer. Seconds between allowed generation of new passwords.

username.description: Specifies the `min` and `max` values of username length. `min` and `max` are integers.

methods.description: List(Map). Verification methods for the domain.

accessKeyId.description: String, Case-sensitive. AWS Access Key ID. Used only for AWS.

apiKey.description: String, Case-sensitive. API Key for your email service. Will always be encrypted in our database.

apiUser.description: String. API User for your email service.

region.description: String. Default region. Used only for AWS, Mailgun, and SparkPost.

secretAccessKey.description: String, Case-sensitive. AWS Secret Key. Will always be encrypted in our database. Used only for AWS.

smtpHost.description: String. Hostname or IP address of your SMTP server. Used only for SMTP.

smtpPass.description: String, Case-sensitive. SMTP password. Used only for SMTP.

smtpPort.description: Integer. Port used by your SMTP server. Please avoid using port 25 if possible because many providers have limitations on this port. Used only for SMTP.

smtpUser.description: String. SMTP username. Used only for SMTP.

messageTypes.description: List(String). Message types to use, array of `sms` and or `voice`. Adding both to array should enable the user to choose.

options.description: List(Resource). Options for the various providers. See Options.

provider.description: String, Case-sensitive. Provider to use, one of `auth0`, `twilio` or `phone-message-hook`.

enrollmentMessage.description: String. This message will be sent whenever a user enrolls a new device for the first time using MFA. Supports liquid syntax, see [Auth0 docs](https://auth0.com/docs/mfa/customize-sms-or-voice-messages).

verificationMessage.description: String. This message will be sent whenever a user logs in after the enrollment. Supports liquid syntax, see [Auth0 docs](https://auth0.com/docs/mfa/customize-sms-or-voice-messages).

awsPartnerEventSource.description: Name of the Partner Event Source to be used with AWS. Generally generated by Auth0 and passed to AWS so this should generally be an output attribute.

azurePartnerTopic.description: Name of the Partner Topic to be used with Azure.  Generally should not be specified.

azureResourceGroup.description: The Azure EventGrid resource group which allows you to manage all Azure assets within one subscription

azureSubscriptionId.description: The unique alphanumeric string that identifies your Azure subscription

httpAuthorization.description: Sent in the HTTP "Authorization" header with each request

httpContentFormat.description: The format of data sent over HTTP. Options are "JSONLINES", "JSONARRAY" or "JSONOBJECT"

httpContentType.description: The ContentType header to send over HTTP.  Common value is "application/json"

httpCustomHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to be included as part of the HTTP request

httpEndpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to send streaming logs

splunkSecure.description: This toggle should be turned off when using self-signed certificates

sumoSourceAddress.description: Generated URL for your defined HTTP source in Sumo Logic for collecting streaming data from Auth0

colors.description: Color scheme used to customize the login pages

logoUrl.description: URL of logo to display on login page

assignMembershipOnLogin.description:
When true, all users that log in
with this connection will be automatically granted membership in the
organization. When false, users must be granted membership in the organization
before logging in with this connection.

connectionId.description:
The connection ID of the connection to add to the
organization

value.description: String. Name of the permission (scope). Examples include `read:appointments` or `delete:appointments`.

resourceServerIdentifier.description: String. Unique identifier for the resource server.

enabled.description: Boolean. Indicates whether to use the custom change password page.

html.description: String, HTML format with supported Liquid syntax. Customized content of the change password page.
String, HTML format with supported Liquid syntax. Customized content of the error page.

showLogLink.description: Boolean. Indicates whether to show the link to logs as part of the default error page.

url.description: String. URL to redirect to when an error occurs rather than showing the default error page.

disableClickjackProtectionHeaders.description: Boolean. Indicated whether classic Universal Login prompts include additional security headers to prevent clickjacking.

enableApisSection.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the APIs section is enabled for the tenant.

enableClientConnections.description: Boolean. Indicates whether all current connections should be enabled when a new client is created.

enableCustomDomainInEmails.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the tenant allows custom domains in emails.

enableDynamicClientRegistration.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the tenant allows dynamic client registration.

enableLegacyLogsSearchV2.description: Boolean. Indicates whether to use the older v2 legacy logs search.

enablePipeline2.description: Boolean. Indicates whether advanced API Authorization scenarios are enabled.

enablePublicSignupUserExistsError.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the public sign up process shows a user_exists error if the user already exists.

universalLogin.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the tenant uses universal login.

enabled.description: Boolean. Indicates whether to use the custom Guardian page.

html.description: String, HTML format with supported Liquid syntax. Customized content of the Guardian page.

colors.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for Universal Login colors. See Universal Login - Colors.

pageBackground.description: String, Hexadecimal. Background color of login pages.

primary.description: String, Hexadecimal. Primary button background color.

provider.description:
The provider type for the auth0 package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

code.description: The source code of the action.

dependencies.description: List of third party npm modules, and their versions, that this action depends on.

deploy.description:
Deploying an action will create a new immutable version of the action.
If the action is currently bound to a trigger, then the system will begin executing the newly deployed version of the
action immediately. Default is `false`.

runtime.description: The Node runtime. For example `node16`, defaults to `node12`.

secrets.description: List of secrets that are included in an action or a version of an action.

supportedTriggers.description:
List of triggers that this action supports. At this time, an action can only target
a single trigger at a time.

versionId.description: Version ID of the action. This value is available if `deploy` is set to true.

breachedPasswordDetection.description: Breached password detection protects your applications from bad actors logging in with stolen credentials.

bruteForceProtection.description: Safeguards against a single IP address attacking a single user account.

suspiciousIpThrottling.description: Suspicious IP throttling blocks traffic from any IP address that rapidly attempts too many logins or signups.

addons.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for add-ons for this client. For details, see Add-ons.

allowedClients.description: List(String). List of applications ID's that will be allowed to make delegation request. By default, all applications will be allowed.

allowedLogoutUrls.description: List(String). URLs that Auth0 may redirect to after logout.

allowedOrigins.description: List(String). URLs that represent valid origins for cross-origin resource sharing. By default, all your callback URLs will be allowed.

appType.description: String. Type of application the client represents. Options include `native`, `spa`, `regular_web`, `non_interactive`, `rms`, `box`, `cloudbees`, `concur`, `dropbox`, `mscrm`, `echosign`, `egnyte`, `newrelic`, `office365`, `salesforce`, `sentry`, `sharepoint`, `slack`, `springcm`, `zendesk`, `zoom`.

callbacks.description: List(String). URLs that Auth0 may call back to after a user authenticates for the client. Make sure to specify the protocol (https://) otherwise the callback may fail in some cases. With the exception of custom URI schemes for native clients, all callbacks should use protocol https://.

clientId.description:
String. ID of the client.
* `client_secret`<sup>1</sup> - String. Secret for the client; keep this private.

clientSecretRotationTrigger.description: Map. Custom metadata for the rotation. For more info: [rotate-client-secret](https://auth0.com/docs/get-started/applications/rotate-client-secret).

crossOriginAuth.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not the client can be used to make cross-origin authentication requests.

crossOriginLoc.description: String. URL for the location on your site where the cross-origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow. Used when performing auth in your own domain instead of through the Auth0-hosted login page.

customLoginPage.description: String. Content of the custom login page.

customLoginPageOn.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not a custom login page is to be used.

description.description: String, (Max length = 140 characters). Description of the purpose of the client.

formTemplate.description: String. Form template for WS-Federation protocol.

grantTypes.description: List(String). Types of grants that this client is authorized to use.

initiateLoginUri.description: String. Initiate login uri, must be https.

isFirstParty.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not this client is a first-party client.

isTokenEndpointIpHeaderTrusted.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not the token endpoint IP header is trusted.

jwtConfiguration.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for the JWTs issued for this client. For details, see JWT Configuration.

logoUri.description: String. URL of the logo for the client. Recommended size is 150px x 150px. If none is set, the default badge for the application type will be shown.

mobile.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for mobile native applications. For details, see Mobile.

nativeSocialLogin.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings to toggle native social login for mobile native applications. For details, see Native Social Login

oidcConformant.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not this client will conform to strict OIDC specifications.

organizationRequireBehavior.description: String. Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction when `organization_usage = "require"`. Can be `no_prompt` (default) or `pre_login_prompt`.

organizationUsage.description: String. Defines how to proceed during an authentication transaction with regards an organization. Can be `deny` (default), `allow` or `require`.

refreshToken.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for the refresh tokens issued for this client.  For details, see Refresh Token Configuration.

signingKeys.description: List(Map). List containing a map of the public cert of the signing key and the public cert of the signing key in pkcs7.

sso.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not the client should use Auth0 rather than the IdP to perform Single Sign-On (SSO). True = Use Auth0.

ssoDisabled.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not SSO is disabled.

tokenEndpointAuthMethod.description: String. Defines the requested authentication method for the token endpoint. Options include `none` (public client without a client secret), `client_secret_post` (client uses HTTP POST parameters), `client_secret_basic` (client uses HTTP Basic).

webOrigins.description: List(String). URLs that represent valid web origins for use with web message response mode.

addons.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for add-ons for this client. For details, see Add-ons.

allowedClients.description: List(String). List of applications ID's that will be allowed to make delegation request. By default, all applications will be allowed.

allowedLogoutUrls.description: List(String). URLs that Auth0 may redirect to after logout.

allowedOrigins.description: List(String). URLs that represent valid origins for cross-origin resource sharing. By default, all your callback URLs will be allowed.

crossOriginLoc.description: String. URL for the location on your site where the cross-origin verification takes place for the cross-origin auth flow. Used when performing auth in your own domain instead of through the Auth0-hosted login page.

customLoginPageOn.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not a custom login page is to be used.

formTemplate.description: String. Form template for WS-Federation protocol.

grantTypes.description: List(String). Types of grants that this client is authorized to use.

isFirstParty.description: Boolean. Indicates whether or not this client is a first-party client.

auth0:index/clientGrant:ClientGrant.description:
Auth0 uses various grant types, or methods by which you grant limited access to your resources to another entity without
exposing credentials. The OAuth 2.0 protocol supports several types of grants, which allow different types of access.
This resource allows you to create and manage client grants used with configured Auth0 clients.


## Import

Client grants can be imported using the grant ID (Application -> APIs -> Expand the required API)

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/clientGrant:ClientGrant my_client_grant cgr_XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
```

auth0:index/customDomainVerification:Cus.description:
With Auth0, you can use a custom domain to maintain a consistent user experience. This is a three-step process; you must
configure the custom domain in Auth0, then create a DNS record for the domain, then verify the DNS record in Auth0.
This resource allows for automating the verification part of the process.


## Import

You can import this resource using the custom domain id, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/customDomainVerification:CustomDomainVerification my_custom_domain_verification cd_XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
```

auth0:index/emailTemplate:EmailTemplate.description:
With Auth0, you can have standard welcome, password reset, and account verification email-based workflows built right
into Auth0. This resource allows you to configure email templates to customize the look, feel, and sender identities of
emails sent by Auth0. Used in conjunction with configured email providers.


## Import

This resource can be imported using the template name, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/emailTemplate:EmailTemplate my_email_template welcome_email
```

body.description: String. Body of the email template. You can include [common variables](https://auth0.com/docs/email/templates#common-variables).

enabled.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the template is enabled.

from.description: String. Email address to use as the sender. You can include [common variables](https://auth0.com/docs/email/templates#common-variables).

resultUrl.description: String. URL to redirect the user to after a successful action. [Learn more](https://auth0.com/docs/email/templates#configuring-the-redirect-to-url).

subject.description: String. Subject line of the email. You can include [common variables](https://auth0.com/docs/email/templates#common-variables).

syntax.description: String. Syntax of the template body. You can use either text or HTML + Liquid syntax.

template.description: String. Template name. Options include `verify_email`, `verify_email_by_code`, `reset_email`, `welcome_email`, `blocked_account`, `stolen_credentials`, `enrollment_email`, `mfa_oob_code`, `user_invitation`, `change_password` (legacy), or `password_reset` (legacy).

urlLifetimeInSeconds.description: Integer. Number of seconds during which the link within the email will be valid.

auth0:index/organization:Organization.description:
The Organizations feature represents a broad update to the Auth0 platform that
allows our business-to-business (B2B) customers to better manage their partners
and customers, and to customize the ways that end-users access their
applications. Auth0 customers can use Organizations to:

  - Represent their business customers and partners in Auth0 and manage their
    membership.
  - Configure branded, federated login flows for each business.
  - Build administration capabilities into their products, using Organizations
    APIs, so that those businesses can manage their own organizations.


## Import

Existing organizations can be imported using organization id, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/organization:Organization acme org_XXXXXXXXXXXXXX
```

auth0:index/promptCustomText:PromptCusto.description:
With this resource, you can manage custom text on your Auth0 prompts. You can read more about custom texts
[here](https://auth0.com/docs/customize/universal-login-pages/customize-login-text-prompts).


## Import

This resource can be imported using the import command and specifying the prompt and language separated by *:* , e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/promptCustomText:PromptCustomText example login:en
```

Options include `ar`, `bg`, `bs`, `cs`, `da`, `de`, `el`, `en`, `es`, `et`, `fi`, `fr`, `fr-CA`, `fr-FR`, `he`, `hi`, `hr`, `hu`, `id`, `is`, `it`, `ja`, `ko`, `lt`, `lv`, `nb`, `nl`, `pl`, `pt`, `pt-BR`, `pt-PT`, `ro`, `ru`, `sk`, `sl`, `sr`, `sv`, `th`, `tr`, `uk`, `vi`, `zh-CN`, `zh-TW`

auth0:index/role:Role.description:
With this resource, you can create and manage collections of permissions that can be assigned to users, which are
otherwise known as roles. Permissions (scopes) are created on auth0_resource_server, then associated with roles and
optionally, users using this resource.


## Import

Existing roles can be imported using their id, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/role:Role my_role XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
```

auth0:index/tenant:Tenant.description:
With this resource, you can manage Auth0 tenants, including setting logos and support contact information, setting error
pages, and configuring default tenant behaviors.

> Auth0 does not currently support creating tenants through the Management API. Therefore, this resource can only 
manage an existing tenant created through the Auth0 dashboard. 

Auth0 does not currently support adding/removing extensions on tenants through their API. The Auth0 dashboard must be 
used to add/remove extensions. 


## Import

As this is not a resource identifiable by an ID within the Auth0 Management API, tenant can be imported using a random string. We recommend [Version 4 UUID](https://www.uuidgenerator.net/version4) e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/tenant:Tenant tenant 82f4f21b-017a-319d-92e7-2291c1ca36c4
```

defaultDirectory.description: String. Name of the connection to be used for Password Grant exchanges. Options include `auth0-adldap`, `ad`, `auth0`, `email`, `sms`, `waad`, and `adfs`.

defaultRedirectionUri.description: String. The default absolute redirection uri, must be https and cannot contain a fragment.

enabledLocales.description: List(String). Supported locales for the user interface. The first locale in the list will be used to set the default locale.

errorPage.description: List(Resource). Configuration settings for error pages. For details, see Error Page.

auth0:index/triggerBinding:TriggerBindin.description:
With this resource, you can bind an action to a trigger. Once an action is
created and deployed, it can be attached (i.e. bound) to a trigger so that it
will be executed as part of a flow. 

The list of actions reflects the order in which they will be executed during the
appropriate flow.


## Import

auth0_trigger_binding can be imported using the bindings trigger ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/triggerBinding:TriggerBinding example "post-login"
```

The actions bound to this trigger. For details, see

auth0:index/user:User.description:
With this resource, you can manage user identities, including resetting passwords, and creating, provisioning, blocking,
and deleting users.


## Import

auth0_user can be imported using the user ID, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import auth0:index/user:User user auth0|111111111111111111111111
```

connectionName.description: String. Name of the connection from which the user information was sourced.

email.description: String. Email address of the user.

emailVerified.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the email address has been verified.

nickname.description: String. Preferred nickname or alias of the user.

password.description: String, Case-sensitive. Initial password for this user. Required for non-passwordless connections (SMS and email).

phoneNumber.description: String. Phone number for the user; follows the E.164 recommendation. Used for SMS connections.

phoneVerified.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the phone number has been verified.

roles.description: Set(String). Set of IDs of roles assigned to the user.

userMetadata.description: String, JSON format. Custom fields that store info about the user that does not impact a user's core functionality. Examples include work address, home address, and user preferences.

username.description: String. Username of the user. Only valid if the connection requires a username.

verifyEmail.description: Boolean. Indicates whether the user will receive a verification email after creation. Overrides behavior of `email_verified` parameter.
